message.content:
cs.HCI, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.CYBER, cs.CR 

The paper presents a visual analytical system for detecting misleading news by analyzing linguistic features. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which fall under the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The system also includes an interactive tool for textual analysis, which falls under the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HCI). The paper also discusses the use of metadata, which falls under the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR). Additionally, the paper addresses the issue of cybersecurity, as misleading news can have negative impacts on society, which falls under the sub-category of cybersecurity (cs.CYBER). Finally, the paper discusses the patterns and effectiveness of misleading news detection, which falls under the sub-category of computer security and cryptography (cs.CR).
